entries.description: The Sun represents vitality, consciousness, and the self. It is associated with leadership, creativity, and life force.
The Moon symbolizes intuition, the subconscious, and mystery. It governs emotions, dreams, and the hidden aspects of life.
Mercury represents communication, intellect, and adaptability. It governs thought, learning, and exchange of ideas.
Venus symbolizes love, beauty, and harmony. It governs relationships, art, and sensuality.
Mars represents energy, action, and conflict. It governs courage, aggression, and transformation.
Jupiter symbolizes expansion, abundance, and wisdom. It governs growth, luck, and higher knowledge.
Saturn represents structure, limitation, and discipline. It governs time, karma, and the material world.
Uranus symbolizes innovation, rebellion, and sudden change. It governs individuality, freedom, and revolution.
Neptune represents illusion, spirituality, and the subconscious. It governs dreams, intuition, and the mystical.
Pluto represents transformation, power, and rebirth. It governs death, regeneration, and the hidden forces of life.
Fire represents energy, transformation, and willpower. It is associated with passion, creativity, and destruction leading to renewal.
Water symbolizes emotion, intuition, and the subconscious. It governs feelings, dreams, and the flow of life.
Air represents intellect, communication, and freedom. It governs thought, ideas, and the exchange of knowledge.
Earth symbolizes stability, materiality, and grounding. It governs the physical world, wealth, and the senses.
Aries represents initiative, energy, and leadership. It is associated with courage, ambition, and new beginnings.
Taurus symbolizes stability, sensuality, and material wealth. It governs patience, determination, and the physical senses.
Gemini represents communication, intellect, and adaptability. It governs curiosity, duality, and the exchange of ideas.
Cancer symbolizes intuition, emotion, and protection. It governs family, nurturing, and the subconscious mind.
Leo represents vitality, creativity, and self-expression. It governs leadership, confidence, and the life force.
Virgo symbolizes analysis, service, and purity. It governs organization, health, and attention to detail.
Libra represents balance, harmony, and relationships. It governs fairness, beauty, and diplomacy.
Scorpio symbolizes transformation, power, and mystery. It governs passion, regeneration, and the hidden aspects of life.
Sagittarius represents expansion, adventure, and wisdom. It governs optimism, exploration, and higher learning.
Capricorn symbolizes discipline, ambition, and structure. It governs responsibility, perseverance, and material success.
Aquarius represents innovation, rebellion, and humanitarianism. It governs individuality, freedom, and visionary ideas.
Pisces symbolizes intuition, spirituality, and compassion. It governs dreams, empathy, and the mystical.
Aleph represents the element of Air and the concept of unity. It symbolizes beginnings, potential, and the breath of life.
Beth symbolizes Mercury and the power of communication. It governs intellect, skill, and manifestation.
Gimel represents the Moon and the flow of intuition. It governs the subconscious, mystery, and hidden knowledge.
Daleth symbolizes Venus and the power of love and beauty. It governs fertility, creativity, and abundance.
Heh represents Mars and the energy of action and leadership. It governs courage, ambition, and new beginnings.
Vav symbolizes Venus and the power of harmony and balance. It governs relationships, beauty, and sensuality.
Zayin represents Mercury and the power of communication and choice. It governs duality, partnership, and decision-making.
Cheth represents the Moon and the power of intuition and protection. It governs emotions, nurturing, and the subconscious.
Teth represents the Sun and the power of vitality and courage. It governs strength, creativity, and self-expression.
Yod represents Mercury and the power of analysis and service. It governs wisdom, purity, and attention to detail.
Kaph represents Jupiter and the power of expansion and abundance. It governs luck, growth, and higher knowledge.
Lamed represents Venus and the power of balance and harmony. It governs fairness, beauty, and relationships.
Mem represents Neptune and the power of intuition and spirituality. It governs dreams, emotions, and the mystical.
Nun represents Mars and Pluto and the power of transformation and rebirth. It governs death, regeneration, and the hidden.
Samekh represents Jupiter and the power of expansion and adventure. It governs optimism, exploration, and higher learning.
Ayin represents Saturn and the power of discipline and limitation. It governs responsibility, karma, and material success.
Peh represents Mars and the power of destruction and renewal. It governs conflict, transformation, and sudden change.
Tzaddi represents Saturn and Uranus and the power of innovation and rebellion. It governs individuality, freedom, and visionary ideas.
Qoph represents Jupiter and Neptune and the power of intuition and spirituality. It governs dreams, empathy, and the mystical.
Resh represents the Sun and the power of vitality and consciousness. It governs leadership, creativity, and the self.
Shin represents the element of Fire and the power of transformation. It governs energy, willpower, and spiritual awakening.
Tav represents Saturn and the power of structure and limitation. It governs time, karma, and the material world.
The Fool represents new beginnings, spontaneity, and potential. It symbolizes the journey of life and the courage to take risks.
The Magician symbolizes willpower, skill, and manifestation. It represents the power to transform ideas into reality.
The High Priestess represents intuition, mystery, and the subconscious. It symbolizes hidden knowledge and inner wisdom.
The Empress symbolizes love, beauty, and fertility. It represents abundance, creativity, and nurturing energy.
The Emperor represents authority, structure, and leadership. It symbolizes stability, discipline, and the power to take action.
The Hierophant symbolizes tradition, spirituality, and guidance. It represents the search for meaning and the connection to higher wisdom.
The Lovers represent love, harmony, and choice. It symbolizes relationships, partnerships, and the power of decision-making.
The Chariot represents determination, willpower, and victory. It symbolizes the journey toward success and overcoming obstacles.
Strength represents courage, inner power, and resilience. It symbolizes the ability to overcome challenges through compassion and determination.
The Hermit represents wisdom, introspection, and solitude. It symbolizes the search for truth and inner guidance.
The Wheel of Fortune represents change, cycles, and destiny. It symbolizes the ups and downs of life and the power of fate.
Justice represents fairness, balance, and truth. It symbolizes the consequences of actions and the pursuit of justice.
The Hanged Man represents surrender, perspective, and enlightenment. It symbolizes letting go and seeing things from a new angle.
Death represents transformation, endings, and new beginnings. It symbolizes the cycle of life, death, and rebirth.
Temperance represents balance, harmony, and moderation. It symbolizes the blending of opposites and the pursuit of equilibrium.
The Devil represents temptation, bondage, and materialism. It symbolizes the chains of illusion and the need for liberation.
The Tower represents upheaval, chaos, and revelation. It symbolizes sudden change and the destruction of false structures.
The Star represents hope, inspiration, and renewal. It symbolizes guidance, healing, and the light of the divine.
The Moon represents illusion, intuition, and the subconscious. It symbolizes dreams, emotions, and the hidden aspects of life.
The Sun represents vitality, success, and enlightenment. It symbolizes joy, clarity, and the power of the self.
Judgement represents awakening, rebirth, and transformation. It symbolizes the call to rise and embrace a new purpose.
The World represents completion, fulfillment, and unity. It symbolizes the end of a cycle and the integration of all aspects of life.
The Ace of Wands represents creativity, inspiration, and new beginnings. It symbolizes the spark of life and the potential for growth.
The Two of Wands represents planning, ambition, and future potential. It symbolizes the power to shape one's destiny.
The Three of Wands represents exploration, expansion, and foresight. It symbolizes the realization of long-term goals.
The Four of Wands represents celebration, harmony, and stability. It symbolizes the joy of achievement and community.
The Five of Wands represents conflict, competition, and struggle. It symbolizes the challenges of growth and the need for perseverance.
The Six of Wands represents victory, recognition, and success. It symbolizes the rewards of hard work and leadership.
The Seven of Wands represents defense, perseverance, and standing one's ground. It symbolizes the courage to protect what matters.
The Eight of Wands represents speed, movement, and progress. It symbolizes the rapid unfolding of events and the power of communication.
The Nine of Wands represents resilience, determination, and vigilance. It symbolizes the strength to endure and overcome challenges.
The Ten of Wands represents burden, responsibility, and hard work. It symbolizes the need to delegate and find balance.
The Page of Wands represents enthusiasm, curiosity, and new ideas. It symbolizes the energy of youth and the pursuit of passion.
The Knight of Wands represents adventure, action, and boldness. It symbolizes the pursuit of goals with courage and determination.
The Queen of Wands represents confidence, leadership, and charisma. It symbolizes the power to inspire and influence others.
The King of Wands represents vision, authority, and mastery. It symbolizes the ability to lead with wisdom and strength.
The Ace of Cups represents love, emotion, and spiritual awakening. It symbolizes the overflowing of the heart and the beginning of emotional fulfillment.
The Two of Cups represents partnership, harmony, and mutual attraction. It symbolizes the union of two souls and the power of love.
The Three of Cups represents celebration, friendship, and joy. It symbolizes the coming together of like-minded individuals and shared happiness.
The Four of Cups represents introspection, apathy, and missed opportunities. It symbolizes the need to look within and appreciate what one already has.
The Five of Cups represents loss, regret, and disappointment. It symbolizes the need to focus on what remains rather than what has been lost.
The Six of Cups represents nostalgia, childhood, and innocence. It symbolizes the joy of revisiting the past and reconnecting with one's roots.
The Seven of Cups represents illusion, choices, and wishful thinking. It symbolizes the need to focus on what is real and attainable.
The Eight of Cups represents abandonment, transition, and seeking deeper meaning. It symbolizes the courage to leave behind what no longer serves.
The Nine of Cups represents satisfaction, contentment, and wish fulfillment. It symbolizes the joy of achieving one's desires.
The Ten of Cups represents happiness, harmony, and emotional fulfillment. It symbolizes the joy of family and lasting relationships.
The Page of Cups represents creativity, intuition, and new emotional experiences. It symbolizes the exploration of one's feelings and imagination.
The Knight of Cups represents romance, charm, and emotional pursuit. It symbolizes the pursuit of love and the expression of one's feelings.
The Queen of Cups represents compassion, intuition, and emotional balance. It symbolizes the nurturing and empathetic qualities of the heart.
The King of Cups represents emotional mastery, wisdom, and calmness. It symbolizes the ability to navigate emotions with grace and understanding.
The Ace of Swords represents clarity, truth, and intellectual power. It symbolizes the breakthrough of new ideas and the power of the mind.
The Two of Swords represents balance, indecision, and inner conflict. It symbolizes the need to make a choice and find harmony.
The Three of Swords represents heartbreak, sorrow, and betrayal. It symbolizes the pain of loss and the need for healing.
The Four of Swords represents rest, contemplation, and recovery. It symbolizes the need to pause and recharge before moving forward.
The Five of Swords represents conflict, defeat, and tension. It symbolizes the consequences of selfishness and the need for resolution.
The Six of Swords represents transition, moving on, and finding peace. It symbolizes the journey from turmoil to calm.
The Seven of Swords represents deception, strategy, and stealth. It symbolizes the need to be cautious and protect oneself.
The Eight of Swords represents restriction, fear, and self-imposed limitations. It symbolizes the need to break free from mental constraints.
The Nine of Swords represents anxiety, worry, and despair. It symbolizes the need to confront one's fears and seek support.
The Ten of Swords represents betrayal, endings, and painful lessons. It symbolizes the need to let go and embrace new beginnings.
The Page of Swords represents curiosity, intellect, and new ideas. It symbolizes the pursuit of knowledge and the power of communication.
The Knight of Swords represents action, ambition, and determination. It symbolizes the pursuit of goals with focus and intensity.
The Queen of Swords represents clarity, independence, and truth. It symbolizes the ability to cut through illusions and see things as they are.
The King of Swords represents authority, intellect, and justice. It symbolizes the power to make decisions with logic and fairness.
The Ace of Disks represents material wealth, stability, and new opportunities. It symbolizes the potential for growth and prosperity.
The Two of Disks represents change, adaptability, and balance. It symbolizes the need to juggle responsibilities and maintain harmony.
The Three of Disks represents teamwork, craftsmanship, and collaboration. It symbolizes the rewards of hard work and dedication.
The Four of Disks represents stability, security, and control. It symbolizes the need to protect one's resources and maintain order.
The Five of Disks represents hardship, poverty, and struggle. It symbolizes the need to persevere and find hope in difficult times.
The Six of Disks represents generosity, charity, and giving. It symbolizes the importance of sharing one's wealth and helping others.
The Seven of Disks represents patience, perseverance, and long-term investment. It symbolizes the need to wait for the fruits of one's labor.
The Eight of Disks represents skill, craftsmanship, and dedication. It symbolizes the mastery of one's craft and the pursuit of excellence.
The Nine of Disks represents abundance, luxury, and self-sufficiency. It symbolizes the rewards of hard work and the enjoyment of material comforts.
The Ten of Disks represents wealth, legacy, and family. It symbolizes the culmination of material success and the passing on of one's achievements.
The Page of Disks represents practicality, learning, and new opportunities. It symbolizes the pursuit of knowledge and the potential for growth.
The Knight of Disks represents diligence, responsibility, and hard work. It symbolizes the steady pursuit of goals and the importance of perseverance.
The Queen of Disks represents nurturing, abundance, and practicality. It symbolizes the ability to create and sustain material wealth.
The King of Disks represents authority, stability, and material success. It symbolizes the mastery of the physical world and the ability to lead with wisdom.
The number 1 represents unity, beginnings, and individuality. It symbolizes the self, leadership, and the spark of creation.
The number 2 represents duality, balance, and partnership. It symbolizes harmony, intuition, and the power of choice.
The number 3 represents creativity, expansion, and growth. It symbolizes the union of opposites and the power of manifestation.
The number 4 represents stability, structure, and discipline. It symbolizes the material world and the foundation of reality.
The number 5 represents change, freedom, and adventure. It symbolizes the dynamic energy of life and the pursuit of new experiences.
The number 6 represents harmony, love, and responsibility. It symbolizes the balance between the material and spiritual worlds.
The number 7 represents spirituality, intuition, and mystery. It symbolizes the search for truth and the connection to the divine.
The number 8 represents power, success, and transformation. It symbolizes the cycles of life and the mastery of the material world.
The number 9 represents completion, wisdom, and fulfillment. It symbolizes the end of a cycle and the integration of all experiences.
The number 10 represents completion, cycles, and new beginnings. It symbolizes the culmination of a journey and the start of a new one.
The number 11 represents inspiration, intuition, and enlightenment. It symbolizes the connection to higher consciousness and the power of transformation.
The number 12 represents completion, harmony, and spiritual awakening. It symbolizes the integration of the material and spiritual worlds.
The number 13 represents transformation, rebirth, and renewal. It symbolizes the end of one cycle and the beginning of another.
The number 14 represents balance, moderation, and healing. It symbolizes the blending of opposites and the pursuit of harmony.
The number 15 represents temptation, bondage, and materialism. It symbolizes the chains of illusion and the need for liberation.
The number 16 represents upheaval, chaos, and revelation. It symbolizes sudden change and the destruction of false structures.
The number 17 represents hope, inspiration, and renewal. It symbolizes guidance, healing, and the light of the divine.
The number 18 represents illusion, intuition, and the subconscious. It symbolizes dreams, emotions, and the hidden aspects of life.
The number 19 represents vitality, success, and enlightenment. It symbolizes joy, clarity, and the power of the self.
The number 20 represents awakening, rebirth, and transformation. It symbolizes the call to rise and embrace a new purpose.
The number 21 represents completion, fulfillment, and the integration of all aspects of life. It symbolizes the end of a cycle and the mastery of the material world.
The number 22 represents mastery, fulfillment, and the completion of a great work. It symbolizes the integration of all aspects of life.
The circle represents wholeness, infinity, and cycles. It symbolizes unity, completion, and the eternal nature of the universe.
The triangle represents creativity, harmony, and manifestation. It symbolizes the union of opposites and the power of the trinity.
The square represents stability, structure, and the material world. It symbolizes the foundation of reality and the power of discipline.
The pentagram represents balance, protection, and the elements. It symbolizes the harmony of spirit and matter and the power of the five elements.
The hexagram represents harmony, balance, and the union of opposites. It symbolizes the integration of the spiritual and material worlds.
The octagon represents regeneration, infinity, and the cycles of life. It symbolizes the power of transformation and the eternal nature of existence.
The spiral represents growth, evolution, and the journey of the soul. It symbolizes the unfolding of consciousness and the path to enlightenment.
The cube represents stability, structure, and the material world. It symbolizes the foundation of reality and the power of discipline.
The star represents guidance, inspiration, and hope. It symbolizes the light of the divine and the path to spiritual awakening.
The cross represents balance, sacrifice, and the union of opposites. It symbolizes the integration of the spiritual and material worlds.
Ra is the Egyptian god of the Sun, representing vitality, consciousness, and the self. He symbolizes leadership, creativity, and the life force.
Isis is the Egyptian goddess of magic, motherhood, and intuition. She symbolizes the power of the subconscious and the mysteries of life.
Thoth is the Egyptian god of wisdom, writing, and communication. He symbolizes intellect, skill, and the power of manifestation.
Hathor is the Egyptian goddess of love, beauty, and fertility. She symbolizes harmony, abundance, and the nurturing energy of nature.
Ares is the Greek god of war, representing energy, action, and conflict. He symbolizes courage, aggression, and the power of transformation.
Zeus is the Greek god of the sky and thunder, representing authority, expansion, and wisdom. He symbolizes leadership, abundance, and higher knowledge.
Kronos is the Greek god of time, representing structure, limitation, and discipline. He symbolizes the mastery of time and the material world.
Poseidon is the Greek god of the sea, representing intuition, emotion, and the subconscious. He symbolizes the flow of life and the mysteries of the deep.
Hades is the Greek god of the underworld, representing transformation, power, and rebirth. He symbolizes the hidden forces of life and the cycle of death and regeneration.
Apollo is the Greek god of the Sun, music, and prophecy. He represents creativity, enlightenment, and the power of the self.
Athena is the Greek goddess of wisdom, strategy, and warfare. She symbolizes intellect, skill, and the power of strategic thinking.
Diana is the Roman goddess of the hunt, the moon, and nature. She symbolizes independence, intuition, and the mysteries of the wild.
Vulcan is the Roman god of fire and craftsmanship. He symbolizes creativity, transformation, and the power of the forge.
Shiva is the Hindu god of destruction and transformation. He symbolizes the cycles of creation, preservation, and dissolution.
Kali is the Hindu goddess of time, destruction, and empowerment. She symbolizes the transformative power of chaos and the liberation from fear.
Osiris is the Egyptian god of the afterlife, resurrection, and fertility. He symbolizes the cycles of death and rebirth and the promise of eternal life.
Horus is the Egyptian god of the sky and kingship. He symbolizes protection, power, and the triumph of light over darkness.
Anubis is the Egyptian god of mummification and the afterlife. He symbolizes the weighing of the soul and the journey to the underworld.
Bastet is the Egyptian goddess of home, fertility, and protection. She symbolizes joy, playfulness, and the nurturing energy of the home.
Set is the Egyptian god of chaos, storms, and the desert. He symbolizes disruption, transformation, and the power of change.
Michael is the archangel of protection, courage, and strength. He symbolizes the power of the Sun and the triumph of light over darkness.
Gabriel is the archangel of communication, intuition, and dreams. He symbolizes the power of the Moon and the mysteries of the subconscious.
Raphael is the archangel of healing, intellect, and communication. He symbolizes the power of Mercury and the exchange of knowledge.
Anael is the archangel of love, beauty, and harmony. He symbolizes the power of Venus and the nurturing energy of nature.
Samael is the archangel of destruction, transformation, and justice. He symbolizes the power of Mars and the energy of conflict and renewal.
Zadkiel is the archangel of mercy, expansion, and wisdom. He symbolizes the power of Jupiter and the pursuit of higher knowledge.
Cassiel is the archangel of solitude, discipline, and time. He symbolizes the power of Saturn and the mastery of the material world.
Asariel is the archangel of intuition, dreams, and the subconscious. He symbolizes the power of Neptune and the mysteries of the deep.
Azrael is the archangel of death, transformation, and rebirth. He symbolizes the power of Pluto and the cycles of life and death.
Uriel is the archangel of innovation, rebellion, and enlightenment. He symbolizes the power of Uranus and the pursuit of freedom and individuality.
Metatron is the archangel of divine wisdom and the scribe of God. He symbolizes the power of Saturn and the mastery of time and karma.
Raziel is the archangel of mysteries and hidden knowledge. He symbolizes the power of Mercury and the pursuit of esoteric wisdom.
Haniel is the archangel of grace, beauty, and harmony. He symbolizes the power of Venus and the nurturing energy of love.
Sandalphon is the archangel of prayer and the protector of unborn children. He symbolizes the power of the Moon and the mysteries of the subconscious.
Jophiel is the archangel of wisdom and illumination. He symbolizes the power of the Sun and the pursuit of enlightenment.
